instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.ALL_SYS: What is ALL_SYS? This is a typo of ALL_SYS_PWRGD When you see ALL_SYS, assume they meant to type ALL_SYS_PWRGD.
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message: Looking at a board that started out with quarter fan spin, I noticed that there was a glob of smeared thermal paste by <CHIP>U7201</CHIP>, I cleaned that and found that the thermal paste was now bridging most of the pads on one side of the QFN. I removed <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> with the plan of cleaning the under area and replacing. I found several oxidized pads and 2 that were blown. Now the board gets a green light and then after a while sitting with the magsafe connected or trying to power it on with the power on pads the green lights cuts off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message: If the fan really spins more rails will be pulsing. Check <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message: 0V on <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS</SIGNAL>. The quarter fan spin stopped after cleaning the thermal paste from around <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> with 99% IPA. Since then there has been no fan spin and attempts to power on the board end with the green light off but PP3V42 is unchanged even though the light turns off.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message: First thing is to get a stable green light. Try known good magsafe board and check PP3V42, PPBUS, <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL>, ACOK, etc.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message: I’ve tried 2 dc in boards for some reason when the light cuts out both PP3V42 and <SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL> remains steady even when the light cuts off. I will check smc reset and see if it is getting tripped and causing the light to cut off

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
These voltages remain constant whether the light is on or off:
PP3V42:3.408V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 3.37V
PPBUS: 12.25V
ACOK: 3.255V

Is the ACOK line low enough to cause the light to trigger on / off? The only other thing I am currently looking into is to see if anything by the current sense area is getting hot and failing and then when cooling down working for a short period of time.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="computercaverva, post: 27643"]
PPDCIN: 16.3V
[SIZE=14px][COLOR=#B22222]<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.55V[/COLOR][/SIZE]
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL>: 3.40v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 3.409v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>: 5.027v

No S0/S3 rails.[/QUOTE]


[QUOTE="computercaverva, post: 27695"]These voltages remain constant whether the light is on or off:
PP3V42:3.408V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 3.37V
[SIZE=14px][COLOR=#B22222]PPBUS: 12.25V[/COLOR][/SIZE]
ACOK: 3.255V

Is the ACOK line low enough to cause the light to trigger on / off? The only other thing I am currently looking into is to see if anything by the current sense area is getting hot and failing and then when cooling down working for a short period of time.[/QUOTE]



So, what is it??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message: Currently it’s 12.25 after replacing the ISL to try and get a steady green light on the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Quarter Fan Spin
threads.message: SMC is not running. If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> is high then it is probably crap under the SMC or dead SMC.
